data.title: Update to OpenTK 1.1
data.body:
This adds support for OpenGL 4.4 (synced with March 2014
specifications), improves startup time, memory consumption and fixes
various issues on Linux and Windows.

data.title: Fix vsync on WindowsGL
data.body: Affects issue #1184

data.title: Added support for bypassing the content pipeline in MGCB
data.body:
At first glance this PR sounds nonsensical--why would anyone want to bypass content building in a content builder? In short, because we're basically emulating the functionality of the Visual Studio-powered content pipeline, where a common pattern is to just copy an asset to the target directory.

With Visual Studio, you'd include the file in your content project and set the Build Action to either None or Content. In this case you'd add a command to the MGCB response file:

```
/copy:myAssetDir/myAssetFile.raw
```

The file will be copied to a mirrored directory structure in the output directory.

data.title: Fix iOS Build
data.body: This is a fix for iOS build triggering on the Mac build agent.

data.title: MaterialContent Fixes
data.body:
This fixes BasicMaterialContent to correctly store its properties in the OpaqueData dictionary like XNA's content pipeline does.  This is important as processors directly read from OpaqueData when looking for material properties.

Also added the other missing MaterialContent classes.

data.title: Visual Studio 2012 Project Templates not installing
data.body:
I installed MonoGame yesterday from the link on the website, and on the installation wizard I chose that the VS2012 Project Templates will be installed. No projects were installed, and none are shown in the project templates folder. Can this be caused by the fact that I have an Express verion of the Visual Studio? I'd really appreciate some help here.

EDIT:
For the record, I did actually uncheck the checkboxes for installing Project Templates for VS2010 and VS2013.

data.body:
Now including iOS / Android / MacOS for the binaries package
Will update template NuGet for these platforms soon

data.body: What happened to all project and solution files in develop branch?

data.title: [WP8] Texture2D.GetData broken
data.body:
With the PR #2016 of @kfazi GetData doesn't work correctly on Windows Phone 8 anymore. 
Textures with even widths have four small squares on the top. Textures with uneven widths have four small squares on the top, where the first one is greyish, second is blue, third is green and the fourth red.

data.title: Implement web platform (JSIL) stubs and update Protobuild
data.body:
This provides initial support for a Web platform driven by JSIL.  Currently all platform-specific code are empty stubs (so the web platform won't actually work at the moment), but it does set up the requirements such that the code will compile.

It also updates Protobuild, which includes support for the Web platform by the way of invoking the JSIL compiler after an executable project is built.  This allows for transparent compilation to Javascript without developers having to explicitly configure or setup anything.

data.title: More MGFX Tool Refactors
data.body:
This PR removes the Preshader and GLSLOptimizer code which we didn't support, cleans up the namespacing, and adds some stubs for PS4 PSSL support.

No real functional changes to the code.

More to come in future PRs.

data.title: Remove All Uses Of Back Slashes
data.body:
Dealing with multiplatform porting it seems like we're better off using forward slashes exclusively in MonoGame.

Back slashes generally only work on Windows systems.

Forward slashes work on all systems including Windows.

Seems dumb to keep putting slash fixing code to flip one way or another depending on platform.  Instead we should just always normalize to forward slashes.

data.title: MGFX Tool Cleanup
data.body:
This is the first of some cleanups to the MGFX tools to help support more than HLSL and GLSL effects.

This has only one real functional change which replaces the old DirectX flag with an enum for ShaderProfile.  The rest is all renames to remove all the DX prefixes from the internal classes and moving some types to their own files.

More PRs will follow.

data.title: Add PlayStation4 to content pipeline target platforms.
data.body: Also includes a helper class for running external tools. Needed for our purposes, but should also come in handy for the ffmpeg/vorbis side on Linux and Mac.

data.title: Fixed a MediaPlayer.Play() bug on windows
data.body:
re: this issue: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2330
where only the first call to MediaPlayer.Play() takes effect, and subsequent calls will simply re-play the first song.

I've found that if a session is closed after being stopped, before the next song's topology is loaded, the correct song will be loaded and played, and the SharpDX exception is no longer thrown.
I have tested locally (windows 7) and it appears to work.

data.title: Video player split
data.body:
Related to #2251 and #2270

Split Video/VideoPlayer classes on a per-API basis. No functional changes.

data.title: Remove SaveStateMode
data.body:
We still have the old SaveStateMode enum from XNA3.1...

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.savestatemode(v=xnagamestudio.31).aspx

This should be removed from MonoGame.

data.title: MonoGame 3.2 IndexOf() StackOverflow
SoundEffectInstance.IsLooped won't play at all on Android
data.body:
I'm trying to play background menu music and if I set IsLooped to true it will not play anything. If I set it to false it will play menu theme, but only once. I tried it with mp3 and wav and result was same. This applies only to Android. On other platforms it works fine. 

Does anybody know how to solve this? Any help appreciated.

data.title: GetValueVector3/4Array implementation
data.body: this time with the little exception check.

data.title: GetValueVector3/4Array implementation
data.body: Replicated behavior from GetValueVector2Arry for vector3 and 4.

data.title: Fix bug where GraphicsDevice.Clear() always cleared stencil and depth buffers.
data.body:
This was a consequence of moving platform-specific code that prior to @eeafc23378861d1401ebdba417431b4e850e8abf only ran for the single-parameter form of Clear() into a PlatformClear() method used by all forms of Clear().

This change splits it out again.

data.title: Android RenderTarget2D.GetData/SetData Inconsistencies and Problems On Pause/Resume
data.body:
Hi,

I am writing some code to get around the annoying issue of references to RenderTarget2D objects being lost when an Android app is sent to the background. What I am trying to do is cache the raw data for these offscreen images when the app is sent to background using RenderTarget2D.GetData and then recreate them when the app is sent to the foreground using RenderTarget2D.SetData.

This is all kind of working apart from when the texture is recreated with SetData the colours are going all weird like the byte order has been changed or something. if I do the Get/Set process again on recreation it flips everything back to normal and things look fine!

Is this a bug or something I am doing wrong? My render targets are created with SurfaceFormat.Color so I'm guessing UInt32 is the correct format to use for storing the data here? The code is roughly analogous to this kind of thing...

```
UInt32[] data;
// on pause
data    = new UInt32[ texture.Width*texture.Height  ];
texture.GetData (data);

// on resume
// first recreate the texture and then...
texture.SetData (data);

// all looks weird unless I add this again...
texture.GetData (data);
texture.SetData (data);
```

Any insight appreciated...

Something else problematic I have noticed is that after repeatedly sending the app to background and returning it to foreground I start to lose the GL context on recreated textures even if I appear to have recreated them properly. This is also the case with Texture2D objects created using LoadContent (ie when MonoGame is handling the recreation of the texture).

I don't know if it's anything to do with it but I noticed in the logs that each time I send the app to background and resume the following piece of output in the logs (which only appears once when the app is first launched) appears again as expected bit is duplicated for each background/foreground cycle, so you end up with this piece of output repeated many, many times which doesn't seem right... though it could be pilot error!

```
[MonoGame] Supported extensions:
[MonoGame] GL_OES_EGL_image
[MonoGame] GL_OES_depth24
[MonoGame] GL_OES_depth32
[MonoGame] GL_OES_element_index_uint
[MonoGame] GL_OES_texture_float
[MonoGame] GL_OES_texture_float_linear
[MonoGame] GL_OES_compressed_paletted_texture
[MonoGame] GL_OES_compressed_ETC1_RGB8_texture
[MonoGame] GL_OES_depth_texture
[MonoGame] GL_OES_texture_half_float
[MonoGame] GL_OES_texture_half_float_linear
[MonoGame] GL_OES_packed_depth_stencil
[MonoGame] GL_OES_vertex_half_float
```

data.title: GameWindow.AllowAltF4 property
data.body:
This is remake of my last commit - now its clear and contains all changes which Steve described to me. 

"In some cases, for some application with monogame, usage of alt+f4 for closing window is not advisable. What if developer wants to decrease the number of legal ways for closing app or want to use this combo with KeyboardState for his/her own purposes ? (example: shows in-game closing dialog by pressing alt+f4 instead immediate shutdown) So, why not add new possibility for developers ? The property called GameWindow.AllowAltF4. By default its true => nothing changed for existing apps. It works on WindowsDX and all OpenTK derived projects, but not on WinRT. It does not affect performance, nor standart window closing procedure(by click). If name(AllowAltF4) is not desirable I rename it to your version - suggest."

data.title: PortraitOrLandscape support for Wp8
data.body:
Hello,
I'm running the last beta develop version of Monogame for wp8.
When I run my game in Portrait or Landscape mode, no problem.
But as soon as I try PortraitOrLandscape mode, only Portrait is displayed correctly and when orientation changed to landscape, the Window.ClientBounds remains in portrait size and CurrentOrientation is still Portrait.
Maybe I'm missing something.
Thanks in advance for your help.

data.title: Convert Content Pipeline To Protobuild
data.body: This PR makes the new content pipeline projects be generated by Protobuild.

data.title: Issues with MediaPlayer.Play and Resume with SharpDX
data.body:
I don't know if an issue is open for this.
these are the issues taken from https://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/528610#

1) I can't change a Song. Once I played a Song (let's say song1), any other call to Play(songX) will result in song1 to play again (calling Stop before doesn't change anything). 

2) Pausing and resuming a song raise a SharpDX exception:
"HRESULT: [0x80004003], Module: [General], ApiCode: [E_POINTER/Invalid pointer], Message: Invalid pointer"
at SharpDX.Result.CheckError()
at SharpDX.MediaFoundation.MediaSession.Start(Nullable guidTimeFormatRef, Nullable varStartPositionRef)
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Media.MediaPlayer.Resume()

i am using the MonoGame source from develop (latest pull)
Windows 7 x64 
Visual studio 2010 pro

would like to get this working as i would like to switch our projects to using the DX version for production runs.
